memories.content: Fixed Coolify deployment issue by replacing fragile multi-line nginx config RUN command with proper nginx.conf file copy. The issue was the complex echo command with backslashes causing nginx startup failures. Solution: created nginx.conf file and used COPY command instead.
memories.context: Kanri project Dockerfile nginx configuration deployment fix

memories.content: Updated Kanri Dockerfile to properly handle nginx configuration: 1) Remove default nginx config before copying custom one, 2) Set proper permissions on html files with chmod -R 755. This should resolve deployment conflicts and startup issues.
memories.context: Kanri project nginx Dockerfile deployment fix

memories.content: Fixed Kanri deployment issue where site showed nginx default page instead of app. Problem was in Dockerfile file copy logic - the cp command could fail silently leaving empty /tmp/html directory. Fixed by: 1) ensuring /tmp/html directory exists first, 2) better error handling in copy operation, 3) added debugging with ls -la, 4) added health check with curl for monitoring.
memories.context: Kanri Dockerfile nginx static files deployment fix

memories.content: Kanri deployment paradox: health check shows proper Nuxt.js app with correct HTML/CSS/JS assets, but browser still shows nginx default page. This indicates a caching layer (CDN, reverse proxy, or browser) is serving stale content while the actual container serves the correct app.

Fixed Kanri Tauri->browser compatibility by: 1) Created browser-compatibility.client.ts plugin with localStorage-based LazyStore mock, file system mocks, dialog mocks, etc. 2) Updated tauriStore.js to use mocks in browser. 3) Fixed errorHandler.ts for browser logging. 4) Updated app.vue to conditionally import Tauri APIs. 5) Created useTauriCompat composable for dynamic API loading. 6) Updated kanban/[id].vue to use getTauriApi() for all Tauri calls (dialog.save, fs.writeTextFile, core.convertFileSrc, etc.)
memories.context: Kanri Tauri desktop app browser compatibility deployment fix
